intro: Veronica teucrium var. lutetiana, commonly known as the Lutetian speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in whorls along the stems, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, opposite, and often covered in a fine white coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland margins and wet meadows.
